title: Question Formation Basics
content:
Teacher: Today we will learn how to form questions in English. In Chinese, we often just add a particle or change intonation, but English changes the word order.

Student: [Where are you going?|You are going where?] 
Teacher: Good. We move the auxiliary verb 'are' to the front.

Student: [Do you like this?|You like this?] 
Teacher: Yes. For regular verbs, we add 'Do' at the start.

Let's practice more:

1. [What is your name?|Your name is what?]
2. [Are you ready?|You are ready?]
3. [Does she speak English?|She speaks English?]
4. [Where does he live?|He lives where?]
5. [Can you help me?|You can help me?]
explanation-zh-TW:
英文疑問句需要調整語序。
1. Be動詞 (am, is, are) 或助動詞 (can, will) 要移到主詞前面。
   例如: You are ready. -> Are you ready?
2. 一般動詞疑問句需在句首加助動詞 Do/Does。
   例如: You like this. -> Do you like this?
3. 疑問詞 (Where, What, How) 永遠放在句首。
   例如: Where are you going?
explanation-en-US:
English questions require changing the word order.
1. Move the Be verb (am, is, are) or auxiliary verb (can, will) before the subject.
   e.g., You are ready. -> Are you ready?
2. For other verbs, use the auxiliary 'Do' or 'Does' at the beginning.
   e.g., You like this. -> Do you like this?
3. Question words (Where, What, How) always go at the very front.
   e.g., Where are you going?

title: Advanced Questions
content:
Teacher: Now let's try some longer questions.

Student: [When will you arrive?|You will arrive when?]
Teacher: 'Will' comes before 'you'.

Student: [Why did he leave early?|Why he left early?]
Teacher: Even with 'Why', we still need an auxiliary verb (did).

Practice:
1. [How have you been?|How you have been?]
2. [What were they doing?|They were doing what?]
3. [Should I call him?|I should call him?]
4. [Who are you waiting for?|You are waiting for who?]
explanation-zh-TW:
即使有疑問詞 (When, Why, How, What, Who)，助動詞依然要放在主詞前面。
例如: Why did he leave? (正確)
Why he left? (錯誤 - 缺少助動詞倒裝)
explanation-en-US:
Even with question words (When, Why, How, What, Who), the auxiliary verb must come before the subject.
e.g., Why did he leave? (Correct)
Why he left? (Incorrect - missing auxiliary inversion)

title: Daily Routine Questions
content: [Do you wake up|You wake up] early? [Does she brush|She brushes] her teeth? [Do they eat|They eat] breakfast? [Does he drive|He drives] to work? [Do we start|We start] now?
explanation-zh-TW: Yes/No questions with regular verbs need Do/Does at the start.
explanation-en-US: Start with Do/Does for simple present questions.

title: Where and When
content: [Where do you live?|Where you live?] [When does it start?|When it starts?] [What do you want?|What you want?] [Why does she cry?|Why she cries?] [How do we go?|How we go?]

title: Past Tense Questions
content: [Did you go|You went] to school? [Did she see|She saw] the movie? [Did they play|They played] well? [Did he finish|He finished] his work? [Did it rain|It rained] yesterday?
explanation-en-US: Use 'Did' + base verb for past questions.

title: Future Questions
content: [Will you come|You will come] tomorrow? [Will it rain|It will rain] soon? [Will they win|They will win]? [Will she angry|Will she be angry]? (Wait, Will she be angry covers Be). [Will he go|He will go]?
explanation-zh-TW: Will + Subject + Verb. Don't forget 'be' if there's no action verb!

title: Can and Could
content: [Can you swim|You can swim]? [Could he help|He could help]? [Can we go|We can go]? [Can she sing|She can sing]? [Could you open|You could open] the door?
explanation-zh-TW: Modal verbs (Can, Could) move to the front.

title: Is and Are
content: [Is he|He is] your brother? [Are they|They are] here? [Is it|It is] cold? [Are we|We are] lost? [Am I|I am] right?
explanation-zh-TW: Be verbs (Is, Are, Am) move to the front.
explanation-en-US: Move Be verb to the front.

title: Wh- with Be Verbs
content: [Where is|Where be] my bag? [Who is|Who be] that man? [What are|What be] those? [Why are|Why be] you sad? [How is|How be] your mom?

title: What doing?
content: [What are you doing?|What you are doing?] [Where is he going?|Where he is going?] [Why are they laughing?|Why they are laughing?] [Who is she talking to?|Who she is talking to?] [What is it eating?|What it is eating?]
explanation-zh-TW: Question word + Be verb + Subject + V-ing.

title: Have you ever?
content: [Have you seen|You have seen] this? [Has she eaten|She has eaten] yet? [Have they finished|They have finished]? [Has he been|He has been] to Japan? [Have we met|We have met]?
explanation-zh-TW: Present Perfect Questions: Have/Has + Subject + V3.

title: Negative Questions
content: [Don't you like|You don't like] pizza? [Doesn't she know|She doesn't know]? [Didn't you go|You didn't go]? [Aren't they happy|They aren't happy]? [Isn't it nice|It isn't nice]?
explanation-zh-TW: Negative questions start with Don't, Doesn't, Didn't, Isn't, Aren't.

title: Tag Questions (Short)
content: You are happy, [aren't you|are you]? She is nice, [isn't she|is she]? He can swim, [can't he|can he]? You like it, [don't you|do you]? They played well, [didn't they|did they]?

title: Subject Questions
content: [Who wants|Who does want] ice cream? [What happened|What did happen]? [Who broke|Who did break] the window? [Who lives|Who does live] here? [What fell|What did fall]?
explanation-zh-TW: Asking about the subject: No Do/Does/Did helper needed!

title: Polite Requests
content: [Would you like|You would like] some tea? [May I have|I may have] a cookie? [Could you help|You could help] me? [Shall we go|We shall go]? [Can I ask|I can ask] a question?
explanation-zh-TW: Polite structures move Modal to front.
explanation-en-US: Modals moved to front for requests.
